clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Value of Non-fasting Blood Lipid Levels for Cardiovascular Events in Community Population(PICC Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Value of Non-fasting Blood Lipid Levels for Cardiovascular and Cerebrovascular Events in Community Population(PICC Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Numerous studies have shown that non-fasting blood lipid levels are closely related to the occurrence of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events, but it is still unclear in the Chinese population. The purpose of the study is to investigate the association between non-fasting blood lipid levels and adverse outcomes in Chinese community population.

detailed_description.textblock: Study population includes subjects who living in community, of any race or ethnicity, 18 or older years of age, and have provided written informed consent to provide biological sample at one or more study visits. Physical examination, questionnaire survey and biological sample collection will be conducted at baseline and the incidence of a composite of major adverse cardiovascular events will be investigated during follow-up.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
primary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality was confirmed through a combination of hospital medical records, telephone contacts with patients or family members, and death registration at the Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
primary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular mortality was defined as death attributable to an ischemic cardiovascular cause (including fatal cardiovascular events and stroke).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 years
primary_outcome.description: The number of and the incidence rate of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases.

biospec_descr.textblock: This study will collect 20 mL whole blood samples from subjects at one or more study visits. The whole blood will be processed to plasma and stored for testing.

study_pop.textblock: Study population includes subjects who living in community, of any race or ethnicity, 18 or older years of age, and have provided written informed consent.
